resources.string: Soup with Asa and tofu.\n Asa is green seaweed which harvested in Okinawan sea.
Soup made from white squid\'s ink.

Soup with white miso.
 "Ina" means boar, "muduchi" means fake.
 Although it used to made by boar meet, 
thesedays it's made by pork instead. Castilla kamaboko is Okinawan traditional food which is boiled and fried fish paste added amount of egg.
Okinawan dish which fries kelp(seaweed), pork, and vegetables.\n "Kubu" means kep, "Irichi" means stir-fries.
Okinawan dish which fries goya(bitter melon), tofu, and vegetables.\n "chanpuru" means mix/stir.
Tofu made from peanut.\n Although tofu is usually made by soy, Jimami tofu is made by peanut instead. "Jimami" means peanut.
Okinawan style seasoned rice.\n Seasoned rice is dish which cooks rice with ingredients and stock.
Okinawan dish in which the ingredients of a Mexican taco are seved on warm rice, with salsa on top.
Okinawan dish which simmers and seasons pig\'s leg with tofu, seaweed, and vegetable. "Tebichi" means pig\'s leg.
Okinawan dish which simmers hechima and pork (or tofu) with miso.\n "Nabera" means hechima which is a vegetable.\n "N'bushi" means simmered with miso.
Stir fry which has papaya as main vegetable.\n "Irichi"means stir-fries.
Thin savor pan cake whixh mixes chive, leeks, tuna in flour and water.
Dish which fries canned pork and egg with ketchup.
Dish which marinates steamed pork in black sesame sauce.
"Mimiga" means pig\'s ear.\n Chop up the boiled or steamed pig\'s ear and eaten with vinegar, miso, and peanut butter.
Mozuku seaweed which seasoned with vinegar.
Dish which simmers goat meat with vegetable.
Yushi Tofu is fluffy soft tofu which is eaten in soup.
Sweet and tender simmered pork.
Noodle made from flour.\n Toppings are thick slice of stewed pork, kamaboko and leeks.\n Soup is made from pork and bonito stocks.
Umibudo is a kind of seaweed which is harvested in Okinawan sea eaten by raw with soy sauce or vinegar.
Dish which puts topping and soup broth on the rice.
Soup simmers tripe, konnyaku, and shiitake mushroom.\n "Nakami" means pork\'s tripe.
Farmented tofu using malted rice and Awamori.
Stir fry which has carrot strips, tuna and egg.\n "Ninjin" means carrot and "Shiri-shiri" means slice.\n "Ninjin sihiri-shiri" means to slice carrot.
